name: Sachse Muslim Society
mission: Sachse Muslim Society (SMS) is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization that was established in 2014. We are dedicated to religious education and community service. SMS serves Sachse, Wylie, Rowlett, North Garland, Rockwall, and Murphy communities.
theoryOfChange: By providing structured Quranic education and a physical masjid space, the organization aims to revive hearts and nurture the spiritual and intellectual growth of the next generation of Muslims.
zakatClaimEvidence: Found 'zakat al-fitr' on https://sachsemasjid.org/ (https://sachsemasjid.org/); Website mission/programs mention zakat (Source: https://sachsemasjid.org/donate/)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: fi_sabilillah (+5); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.
components.name: Underserved Space

alignment.rationale: Alignment 25/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.

risks.risk_summary: Key concern: Program expense ratio critically low: 14%

score_details.score_summary: Sachse Muslim Society shows moderate alignment and moderate impact, with zakat compliance (significant risk deductions applied).

all_citations.claim: The organization operates the Sachse Quran Academy (SQA) including Full Time and Part Time Hifz programs.
The organization provides various donation options and is Zakat-eligible.
The society engages the community through volunteer opportunities and seasonal religious events.
The organization reported total revenue of $2,799,757 and maintains a fundraising efficiency of $0.11 per $1 raised.
Financial data indicates a program expense ratio of 13.6% and working capital of 63.0 months.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization maintains a moderate overall standing with a GMG score of 43/100, reflecting strong financial stability and fundraising efficiency balanced against a lower program expense ratio.
areas_for_improvement: Low program expense ratio of 13.6% suggests a high proportion of spending on non-programmatic costs
Limited public documentation regarding specific long-term outcome metrics

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high donor fit for those seeking Zakat-eligible religious causes, focusing on the urgent need for local religious education and community engagement [2][3].
dimension_explanations.impact: The society provides direct services through its Full Time and Part Time Hifz programs [1]. While it maintains a significant total revenue of $2,799,757 and exceptional working capital of 63.0 months, the program expense ratio is currently 13.6% [4][5].

baseline_narrative.headline: founded in 2014, the Sachse Muslim Society serves as a dedicated hub for religious education and community service in the Sachse area.
strengths: Strong liquidity with 63.0 months of working capital available
Efficient fundraising operations with a cost of only $0.11 per $1 raised
Direct community impact through specialized Hifdh and Quranic programs
baseline_narrative.summary: The Sachse Muslim Society is a religious organization focused on providing comprehensive Quranic education and community support through its Sachse Quran Academy [1]. The organization is recognized as Zakat-eligible and offers multiple giving methods to support its local religious and educational initiatives [2].

rich_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization maintains a moderate overall standing with a GMG score of 43/100, reflecting strong financial stability and fundraising efficiency balanced against a lower program expense ratio.

areas_for_improvement.context: The current <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 13.6%</cite> is significantly below the <cite id="14">peer median of 89.8%</cite>, suggesting that a large portion of funds is being held in reserve or directed toward non-programmatic costs.
The organization currently operates with a <cite id="15">minimal board of 3 members</cite>, which limits the diversity of oversight compared to larger non-profit standards.

bbb_assessment.summary: This organization has not yet been evaluated by the BBB Wise Giving Alliance.

case_against.mitigation_notes: The rapid growth in revenue may explain the temporary lag in program spending as the organization scales its infrastructure.
risk_factors: <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 13.6%</cite> is well below industry norms
<cite id="4">Excessive working capital (63 months)</cite> suggests funds are sitting idle
<cite id="15">Small board size</cite> may pose governance risks
case_against.summary: The primary concern is the <cite id="5">low program expense ratio</cite>, which indicates that less than 40 cents of every dollar donated is currently reaching direct programs.

confidence.notes: Strong financial growth data but limited governance and transparency documentation.

alignment.explanation: There is a high fit for Muslim donors due to <cite id="8">verified zakat eligibility</cite> and a focus on <cite id="9">Islamic education (fi sabilillah)</cite>.
alignment.improvement: Alignment could be further strengthened by <cite id="17">expanding services to underserved populations</cite> beyond the immediate Sachse/Wylie geographic area.

credibility.explanation: SMS is a verified 501(c)(3) with <cite id="3">transparently reported IRS filings</cite> and a clear <cite id="1">mission established since 2014</cite>. However, credibility is limited by <cite id="15">minimal board governance</cite> and a lack of published audited financials.
credibility.improvement: Credibility could be enhanced by <cite id="15">expanding the board of directors</cite> and undergoing an independent financial audit to verify the use of its significant assets.

impact.explanation: The organization provides <cite id="2">direct Quranic education</cite>, but its impact score is affected by a <cite id="5">13.6% program ratio</cite> and <cite id="4">excessive liquidity</cite> that suggests under-utilization of available funds.
impact.improvement: To improve impact, the charity should <cite id="16">publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess reserves</cite> into expanding school capacity or community services.

grantmaking_profile.grant_strategy: Direct service provider; not a grantmaking entity

rich_narrative.headline: founded in 2014, the Sachse Muslim Society serves as a dedicated hub for religious education and community service in the Sachse area.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for local donors in the North Texas area who want to invest in the long-term growth of Islamic educational infrastructure and fulfill zakat through religious education.
donor_motivations: Want to support a growing local masjid and school
Prioritize long-term financial stability in the organizations they support
Value direct provision of Quranic and Hifdh programs
giving_considerations: The organization is currently in a high-growth phase with significant asset accumulation
Donations may be held in reserve for future capital projects rather than immediate spending
Governance is centralized within a small board
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors who prioritize high immediate program spending ratios or those seeking organizations with large, independent boards of directors.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects verified program existence and basic output tracking, but lacks detailed cost-per-beneficiary data.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: SMS creates impact by providing structured Quranic education to youth, fostering a religious identity that strengthens the local community.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Detailed impact data would help donors understand the cost-effectiveness of the Hifdh and Sunday School programs.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: Despite high reserves, the rapid community growth in the Sachse area suggests significant future capital needs for facility expansion.

organizational_capacity.geographic_reach: Sachse, Wylie, Rowlett, North Garland, Rockwall, Murphy

peer_comparison.differentiator: SMS stands out for its <cite id="10">unusually high revenue growth rate</cite> compared to peers like the Islamic Society of Central Jersey.
similar_orgs: The Center for Islamic Teachings and Community Development

strengths.detail: The organization maintains <cite id="4">63.0 months of working capital</cite>, providing a massive buffer for long-term stability and future capital projects.
SMS operates with very low overhead in its development efforts, costing just <cite id="7">$0.11 per $1 raised</cite>.
The society has seen a <cite id="10">3-year revenue CAGR of 290.8%</cite>, indicating strong community trust and expanding support.

strengths_deep_dive: The Sachse Muslim Society has successfully transitioned from a small local group to a significant religious institution, as evidenced by its <cite id="11">total assets reaching $8,345,604</cite> by the end of 2023. This growth is anchored by its <cite id="12">direct delivery model</cite>, where the organization manages its own educational programs rather than outsourcing. Their <cite id="13">volunteer-driven committee structure</cite> allows for community engagement across various operational needs, from maintenance to education, which contributes to their <cite id="7">low fundraising costs</cite>.
rich_narrative.summary: founded in 2014, the Sachse Muslim Society (SMS) serves as a vital religious and educational hub for the Muslim community in <cite id="1">Sachse and surrounding Texas areas</cite>. The organization operates primarily through the Sachse Quran Academy, providing <cite id="2">specialized Hifdh and Quranic programs</cite> alongside community services. Financially, the society reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $2,799,757</cite> in the 2023 tax year, representing a period of significant growth. While the organization maintains <cite id="4">strong liquidity with 63.0 months of working capital</cite>, its current financial structure shows a <cite id="5">program expense ratio of 13.6%</cite>, which is notably lower than the <cite id="6">industry standard of 75%</cite>. Despite this, the society demonstrates high fundraising efficiency, spending only <cite id="7">$0.11 to raise every $1</cite>. As a <cite id="8">zakat-eligible institution</cite>, it provides a local avenue for donors to fulfill religious obligations, specifically supporting the <cite id="9">fi sabilillah (in the way of Allah) asnaf</cite> through its educational initiatives.
